channel.title: Rage
channel.description:
So I finally got around to building my desktop with specs: - i7 2600 - asus p8p67 pro - evga gtx 580 super clocked - 8gb kingston 600mhz - 1tb hitachi - cm 690 II advanced with window - asus 24" led 2ms It's pretty cool, I played games at 1080p for the first time in my life. ... to the point. Intel suddenly decided that:
Intel representatives have announced the discovery of a design issue in the Intel® 6 Series chipset, which supports the 2nd generation Intel® Core™ processors, and we have implemented a silicon fix. In some cases, the Serial ATA (SATA) ports within the chipsets may degrade over time, potentially impacting the performance or functionality of SATA-linked devices, such as hard disk drives and DVD drives.
The catch is that I bought everything contained with in the case from Singapore on my way to Australia (twas much cheaper) so I can't just return them to the store. WTF DO I DO???????????

item.title: Rage
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

JUST USING IDE, LIKE A PRO.

Read full topic

item.title: Rage
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I’d at least call ASUS, but at least you have other options.

Well I have an intention to do so however I’m not quite sure when

Read full topic

item.title: Rage
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

or bitch ASUS out and have them send you a new one for free.

Read full topic

item.title: Rage
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:381818”]I’d be annoyed too, you just have really bad luck I guess.

Anyway, wouldn’t a cheaper fix than buying a new motherboard be getting a good PCI-X SATA controller? Because from what you posted that is the only problem? Something to consider at least.[/quote]

That’s a great idea. I think I’ll just buy one when I have the time/money.

rep++;

Read full topic

item.title: Rage
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

I doubt ASUS will do shit, I suggest you sell it for a high price and buy a new desktop.

Read full topic

@moparisthebest wrote:

I’d be annoyed too, you just have really bad luck I guess.

Anyway, wouldn’t a cheaper fix than buying a new motherboard be getting a good PCI-X SATA controller? Because from what you posted that is the only problem? Something to consider at least.

Read full topic

item.title: Rage
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Why don’t you email/call ASUS and see what they can do for you?

Will do. I’m so damn annoyed. The first time I decided to build a desktop is the first time intel recalls it’s chips, losing upto $300m.

Read full topic

item.title: Rage
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

So I finally got around to building my desktop with specs:

  • i7 2600
  • asus p8p67 pro
  • evga gtx 580 super clocked
  • 8gb kingston 600mhz
  • 1tb hitachi
  • cm 690 II advanced with window
  • asus 24" led 2ms

It’s pretty cool, I played games at 1080p for the first time in my life.

… to the point. Intel suddenly decided that:

Intel representatives have announced the discovery of a design issue in the Intel® 6 Series chipset, which supports the 2nd generation Intel® Core™ processors, and we have implemented a silicon fix. In some cases, the Serial ATA (SATA) ports within the chipsets may degrade over time, potentially impacting the performance or functionality of SATA-linked devices, such as hard disk drives and DVD drives.

The catch is that I bought everything contained with in the case from Singapore on my way to Australia (twas much cheaper) so I can’t just return them to the store. WTF DO I DO???

Read full topic
